message.content: This question requires knowledge about the physics of braking a car. When someone brakes to avoid hitting a deer, the tires make contact with the road and experience friction as they come to a stop. This friction causes wear and tear on the tires, eventually causing them to wear down. Option (A) is incorrect because there is no mention of extra money being given as a result of braking to avoid hitting a deer. Option (B) is not a plausible effect of braking. Option (C) is an anthropomorphization of a deer and not a realistic effect of braking.
